Where Does AI Fit on the Spectrum of Accessibility and Difficulty Aides? - Sam Drage - ACCU 2025
---

Accessibility and difficulty can be seen as two sides of the same coin. This can be illustrated, for example, in the properties of a book. The subject matter, jargon, prerequisite knowledge, and density of ideas is the difficulty, whilst the line length, font size and choice, page texture, and line spacing is the accessibility. A children’s book can be rendered unreadable by poor font choice, whilst a beautifully laid out book on quantum physics can be made illegible by overuse of jargon.
